Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on computer screen] Ah, what else? I've seen Dirty Dancing like, ten times. Breaks my heart every time, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That Swayze sure can dance dirty.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Don't you have any sunblock?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, Walter J has been hoarding it. You want to worry about a part of my body, worry about my eyes. They're like two flaming meatballs in my skull.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Last week Andy set sail for the Bahamas to sell his family's boat, and he took his brother, but not me. I was kind of sad at first, but then I remembered that Bob Marley song -- No, woman. No cry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on computer] Check this out. Keeps my hair out of my stare, also helps me combat the glare bear. That's what I call the sun now.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Andy, it's Darryl. Take your drawers off your head.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What else can I show you? Oh, damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, Andy, was.. was that your drinking water?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was. That's okay though. I got this cool desalinator device. It sucks up sea water through this hose and pumps out fresh water. See, check it out. Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah! That's not good. I better sign off. I hate to get going. I mean these skype sessions are, like, the only thing that keep me sane out here, you know? [laughs crazily]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: He's been sailing for two days.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on computer] I will leave you with this. The image of a man and his boat. Burn this into your brains.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [laughing] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. No! Nooo! [computer falls into ocean]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy? Andy! Andy! Andy. Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [answering phone] Dwight Schrute. [turns on speakerphone] Well, hi there David Wallace. Why would you ever call me when the manager is out of town?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Well, I have some very exciting news.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you didn't call Jim - that seems significant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi, David.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Jim, good! You should hear this too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, he shouldn't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [taking away Dwight's handset] Go ahead David, I'm listening.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, David, I want to take you off speaker but... I don't know where I'd put you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Guys, listen, this is big news. The Scranton White Pages just got in contact with my office the day before yesterday. They've apparently just dropped the supplier they've been with for the last ten years. .

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The White Pages.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The White Pages: Do you want it? No. Do you use it? No. Does it inexplicably show up on your doorstep three times a year? Yes, yes, and yes. There's a reason that we in the paper industry call this thing "the White Whale". Look at all that sweet blubber.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Look, we need our top salesman running point on this and Dwight, that is you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna need to put you on hold for a second. [presses hold button] Hah! Yah! Woooo! Eat it Jim! Eat it Phyllis! Eat... where's Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's in the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Will you run into the bathroom and tell him to eat it?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah! Okay. [presses button again] Hey David, I'm back.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [from the kitchen] Eat it Stanley!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So uh, last I remember Tom Peterman was in charge of that account?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No, I spoke with the receptionist over there. It's someone new but she didn't catch her name.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Her name?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, hey, Dwight shouldn't...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shhh! [clears throat] Thanks David! Thank you so much for calling me!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Good luck!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good luck to you. [disconnects call]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight, you can't go. You have a problem with women. You can't sell to them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is a damnable lie. I love women.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Gina Rogers at Apex Technology said you called her 'gy-na' for your entire meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ew. That's not good.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, she said she corrected him five times.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: 'Gy-na' said that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Guys, we can't let Dwight blow this. An account this size could double our growth. That means raises, bonuses... Pizza Friday could come back.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey remember that week in the 90's when we got bagels?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I miss Clinton.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you go instead?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't. I have the thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have this conference call today with this company in Philly that I'm helping start. Ah, first board meeting. Also, the first time I've ever been excited about work. So, that feels... wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Okay, call down. It's just me, not Tom Selleck.

Quote.Speaker: Guys in breakroom
Quote.Text: [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Toby got us all to participate in Movember. It's a charity for prostate cancer. You pledge money and then you grow a mustache for the month of November.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So, this is how we look now. I hope you like being turned on all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Daaaaamn! It just keeps on coming, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I have very fertile hair glands.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I am so glad I got all of the dudes to do Movember. We have the dopest time back in the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: God!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: We even go to lunch, pick up babes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [to passing female pedestrian] Smile if you love men's prostates.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Spring cleaning?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: More like fall cleaning. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [whispering] I think the senator is having an affair.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [dropping desk drawer] This doesn't... I'm sorry. Wha... what?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think the senator is having an affair.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I literally have nightmares in which what just happened happens. I wake up in a sweat. And then I make Angela's husband spoon me back to bed.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: When he comes home in the morning, he has this secret little smile.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sure ...that's nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And he's always at the yoga studio. He never misses the noon class - it's Hot Yoga with Blake.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, Blake's also a guy's name so he... may be spending his afternoons with a guy named Blake. So nothing to worry about. Huh. Blake. Who is Blake?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I just never heard about the senator and yoga...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: From you. I'm sure it's probably nothing. But what's with the yoga already?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And Blake! All right Angela, calm down! We need to go check this out.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, I'll go with you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: So, uh, show us how you'd normally sell to a female client.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. With pleasure. Get ready to learn a few new tricks, old dog.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You've got this Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay, you just walked into her office and begin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: May I please speak to your boss?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, she is the boss.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I am? Hmm.. [deep voice] Hi, I'm Mr. Hannon. How can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, this isn't working for me, 'cause no one would ever believe that she would be a boss.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's absolutely right. I'm really struggling.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I'll be the buyer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello, Mr. Schrute, nice to see you. Please have a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I never sit down during sales meetings. I want to appear aggressive and imposing. I am going to sell to you in twelve minutes

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No actually, she likes to take her time discussing her needs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will tell her what her needs are and then fill them. So this is going to work out best for you if you just relax and do nothing. And once I'm finished, it's over.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, let's stop here. Anyone have any thoughts?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I thought it went great.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I have uh, written down a few questions. One, have you ever killed a woman? Two, how many women have you killed? Please, sir, will you not kill me?

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: [on phone] Okay lets get started.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm here. Are we all on?

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: Uh,, well you're the only one 'on' - we're all here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [nervous laughter] Right. Okay, uh, over the next three months...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's the winter season., three months.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I uh, I have some ideas, actually...

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: Are you at your office right now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hushed voice] Uh yeah. Trust me, I'd rather be with you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: [laughing] Uh, yeah, that sounded kinda spooky-sexy, over here Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, [clearing throat, deeper voice] Sorry, I uh... was just saying that we should uh...

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: Whoa. [laughing] I think there's been a bit of a mistake. We're trying to reach Jim Halpert, not Batman.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughing] Um, you know what? I.. should have just had... I should have just had you call me on my cell.

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna try a different spot. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I'll call you right back.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What's happening in three months?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, when you're selling to women, it is crucial that you listen, Dwight. Also you want to respect their... Are you listening now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, well you have to show us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's impossible. Listening happens in the ear and in the brain. I mean, some organisms have external hairs that vibrate to indicate auditory stimulation but unfortunately, our external hairs don't vibrate at all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Huh. [nodding] Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A little smile and a nod shows that I hear you. Got it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kind of.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nellie, why don't you tell Dwight what we were doing earlier today. And Dwight, you show us that you're listening.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, we were in the warehouse, where we were discussing a mural that I've commissioned Pam to paint there. We were talking color schemes and the major themes we want to hit. Children of the world, coming together, cutting down trees to make paper. But not in a child labor-y way.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's just up and down, just a regular nod, like a person.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am a person.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: And then we thought we'd ... I can't. I just can't carry on with that face. Look at it. I'm gonna get nightmares with that face. I mean he looks like he's laboring over a stool having just eaten human flesh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's a bit extreme.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No, I'm sorry but that is true.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: He's screwed. They're meeting in less than an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, all right. God, Dwight, just ignore every instinct you have. It's all garbage okay? You're the woman, I'm the salesman, watch what I do and try to learn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm a woman. [high voice] I'm a woman. Good?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ms. Thomas, so good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, are those your kids? They're so cute! They could be models.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. I'm so proud of them. I carried each one of them for nine months inside of my torso and then pushed them out of my vagina.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Booo! Weird.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah. This is a lost cause. It's hopeless.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ten years ago, I didn't care if Dwight got married or died a beet-farming bachelor. But having kids makes you so soft. I used to watch Pulp Fiction and laugh, and now I'm like, that poor gimp is somebody's child.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, I think there could be a lot of benefits if you could learn to get along with women.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look, I have no problem with women. It's businesswomen and their, their power suits and their shoulder pads. Don't lie about your shoulders!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, listen to me. Businesswomen are just normal, nice, reasonable people. Who is a nice, reasonable person in your experience?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had a barber once who used to comb my hair gently.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, so, when you're selling to this woman, just imagine that she's that nice, reasonable barber.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I can do that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. Good. Baby steps.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He used to fight dogs.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Like, he used to make dogs fight? Or he actually fought dogs?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Little of this, little of that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Which one is the instructor? There all fatties.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela! [whispering] Angela. There.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [whispering] On the stairs. Stay calm. Stay down. Oh, so wait. Blake is a her.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh my God! She's so stunningly tiny! She's like a petite double zero, for sure. For sure! Holy cow! Look at what they're doing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She's repositioning his hips for downward facing dog.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [gasps] I've heard of this - dog style. Oh wait. Oh look Oscar, Thumbelina has a boyfriend! And he has a ponytail - ew. I'd like to see that run for office. Oscar, you were right. I had nothing to be worried about. Thank you. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ow.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Shut up, hold on. Shh. Hold on. Sorry. Look.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [sound effect of throwing ball]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This is fun. You know? I mean, this is fun.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What I was saying is the genius of Air Jordan was not in the market saturation, it was in --

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: [on phone] It was in what? Jim, we're having a lot of trouble hearing you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The... the... the... what I was saying is the real genius was...[car alarm blaring] was in the...

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Hey! Are those skateboarders back?

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: [on phone] Jim? Jim, are you there?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Where are they?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was, uh in the authentic design, right? So I mean, you really felt like Michael Jordan was wearing these shoes, so ...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Who was messing with my van?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nobody!

Quote.Speaker: Business partner
Quote.Text: [on phone] Jordan wore them for nobody? We're not following you, Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: This ends now!

Quote.Speaker: Secretary
Quote.Text: Have a seat. Um, she will be right in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, great. Oh, I'm sorry. Do you mind telling me her name? I realized we don't have it.

Quote.Speaker: Secretary
Quote.Text: Uh... um she'll be right in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to himself] Just a little off the top and then a nice combing. Yeah, just comb it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God. It's Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, dear God in heaven.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jan used to be one of my superiors, and she is one of the most erratic and terrifying people I have ever met.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [scene from Dinner Party, Season 4 and The Job Season 3]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You son of a bitch. You're firing me? Where the hell do you get off?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim and I are pretty sure she had an affair with her ex-assistant Hunter. He was 17. But she looks great. If she asks, will you tell her I said that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Forget everything we taught you. Hey, Jan! It's so great to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Where's Wallace?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I was under the impression that David Wallace would be coming. He bought back Dunder Mifflin, correct?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. Your daughter could be a bubble bath model. I could just bite her head off. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry. Um, David is in Vermont. Did you speak with him? He sent Dwight instead.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Molly! David Wallace is in Vermont.

Quote.Speaker: Molly
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Um, I talked to his assistant. And I guess it did get a little confusing 'cause you said not to tell anyone your name. And then also, those bluetooths are very hard to hear with. I know you love the way they look, but Tom never had us use them...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Molly. I am not Tom. I am Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Molly
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I thought it would be fun to have a little chat with uh, David Wallace after all these years. Oh, well. What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listening.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Stop that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So this was all just a trick. You don't really have any business to give?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But not to us.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Insightful, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You did good, Dwight. It's okay. I mean, seriously, Jan's not normal. Let's just go. She's not going to sell to us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, she is. Now, I may not have any instincts with women, but I have an instinct for sales. You keep her occupied. I'll be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm a very busy woman, so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Um, do you have any other pictures of Astrid?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Fine. I will show you one... slide show.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Erin, did this call...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry, I uh, just saw your face.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. It's for the thing.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I know. That's great. It just - it makes it look like there's an eyebrow in the middle of your face.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: A handsome eyebrow, but, um... it makes your mouth look like an eye socket... which isn't bad.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But um, you look like a cyclops whose eye... fell out... Which is great. It's such a great cause.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Mommy, you're a princess. Mommy, you're a superstar. Mommy you're the greatest. How can I ever fill your sho-o-o-es?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow. Your voice is as lovely as ever.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Aw.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And it is so cute how she signs her name.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Well, that -- that was -- that was me too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. It's just that's how Cece does it with the backwards 'E's.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Cece can't spell her name.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, actually she can.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, it's not really much of a comparison, is it? I mean, "Cece" is two letters and "Astrid" is... I mean, there's even some adults who -- who -- who can't spell it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Can you spell it? Try to spell it, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... "A"... "X"? I don't -- you got me.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Don't patronize me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] I'm so sorry. I hate this. You're better.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [whispering] Okay, we should go now. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [stammering wildly] Just wait. Just a minute. Just watch. [scoffs]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Wait. Why are you... Oh. are you getting your jollies right now? Can't get enough of the show? Your jollies are all on fire --

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [whispering] Please. It's Robert who's enjoying it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This could be the affair that you're scared of. Politicians are wonderful liars. You never know who they really are. [pause] But uh, he's probably not gay. He's straight. He's straight, so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm. Excuse me. Could I get some more water?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jan... You thought I had no more cards left to play. Well I've got one. Man-boy! The Ace of Babes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Where's the Quizno's?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're the Quizno's. [chuckles] Jan, may I introduce to you your own personal Dunder Mifflin liaison, devoted to servicing this account with total client satisfaction. I sensed that Molly wasn't quite meeting your needs -- nothing like, uh, your old assistant... Hunter. Was that his name?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I don't recall. And yes, Molly is crap.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, you do not have to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Do what? Get into sales? That's what I want.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's been growing that mustache for weeks. Best he can do... So young.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Will you uh, [clicks tongue] you. Can you turn around for me, please? Dwight you can go. I will call you in a week or so and let you know whether I want your business.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [to Clark] Do you have a valid passport?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Jim Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Colin
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey, it's Colin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey man. I am so sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Colin
Quote.Text: I know. Don't worry about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Colin
Quote.Text: It's just... it's not totally working.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. No, I know. This whole telecommuting thing -- not ideal. But don't worry. I'll figure it out.

Quote.Speaker: Colin
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, it's not just not ideal. I mean, with you there, I don't know how we're gonna do this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, what does -- what does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar, what is happening here? Why would you say you think the senator might be gay?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know, Angela. I'm dehydrated. Maybe... You heard me wrong. We should just go.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Look, look, look. Here he comes. Here he comes. What is he doing?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He's making a phone call.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [ducking under table with Oscar] Oh. Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [phone vibrates, rings]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, Molly. You should just quit.

Quote.Speaker: Molly
Quote.Text: Thanks. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh and uh, Molly... I know it can't be easy working for Jan. Good luck with your feelings.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, that was really nice. You should ask for her number.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I got her number. 415-YCL.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's a license number?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's all you need. And when I have curried favor with her, I will let you know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. Why me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Because you are my friend and you are a woman... And women love gossip. It's like air to you people. Ugh, God. [retching]
